summary: Apple on Monday said the head of its artificial intelligence team is stepping down, and the effort is to be led by a veteran engineer from Google and Microsoft.Subramanya was most recently a corporate vice president of AI at Microsoft, prior to that spending 16 years at Google where he was head of engineering for the Gemini digital assistant before leaving, Apple said.

title: Samsung’s Next Salvo Against Apple: A Triple-Folding Smartphone
summary: SEOUL—The U.S. will soon get its first mass-market smartphone that folds not just once, but twice.  Samsung  Electronics’ Galaxy Z TriFold is expected to hit the shelves in the U.S. as early as the first quarter of 2026, after it goes on sale in South Korea and elsewhere this month.  The new phone is the latest salvo in Samsung’s long-running battle with  Apple  which is expected to introduce its own foldable phone—likely a once-folding model—later next year.

raw.headline: Samsung’s Next Salvo Against Apple: A Triple-Folding Smartphone
raw.summary: SEOUL—The U.S. will soon get its first mass-market smartphone that folds not just once, but twice.  Samsung  Electronics’ Galaxy Z TriFold is expected to hit the shelves in the U.S. as early as the first quarter of 2026, after it goes on sale in South Korea and elsewhere this month.  The new phone is the latest salvo in Samsung’s long-running battle with  Apple  which is expected to introduce its own foldable phone—likely a once-folding model—later next year.

title: Apple to Revamp AI Team After Announcing Top Executive’s Departure
summary: Apple  is shaking up its AI ranks, poaching a  Microsoft  executive and reorganizing after announcing the retirement of its top AI leader, whose tenure was defined by the company’s artificial-intelligence struggles.  John Giannandrea,  the iPhone maker’s senior vice president in charge of AI strategy, who had reported directly to Chief Executive  Tim Cook,  is stepping down, the company announced on Monday, and his duties will be split among other senior vice presidents responsible for software engineering, services and operations.  Amar Subramanya, who helped oversee Google’s Gemini chatbot before decamping to Microsoft earlier this year, will join Apple as vice president of AI, one rung lower than where Giannandrea was in the organization chart.

raw.headline: Apple to Revamp AI Team After Announcing Top Executive’s Departure
raw.summary: Apple  is shaking up its AI ranks, poaching a  Microsoft  executive and reorganizing after announcing the retirement of its top AI leader, whose tenure was defined by the company’s artificial-intelligence struggles.  John Giannandrea,  the iPhone maker’s senior vice president in charge of AI strategy, who had reported directly to Chief Executive  Tim Cook,  is stepping down, the company announced on Monday, and his duties will be split among other senior vice presidents responsible for software engineering, services and operations.  Amar Subramanya, who helped oversee Google’s Gemini chatbot before decamping to Microsoft earlier this year, will join Apple as vice president of AI, one rung lower than where Giannandrea was in the organization chart.

title: Apple names Amar Subramanya new VP of AI, replacing John Giannandrea
summary: Apple on Monday named veteran researcher Amar ​Subramanya as its vice president of AI,‌ replacing John Giannandrea.  Apple — a laggard in the AI ‌race — has been slow to add AI features to its products in comparison to rivals such as Samsung Electronics, which have been quicker ⁠to refresh their ‌devices with AI features.  Subramanya will lead critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models,‍ ML research and will report to software chief Craig Federighi.

Apple — a laggard in the AI ‌race — has been slow to add AI features to its products in comparison to rivals such as Samsung Electronics, which have been quicker ⁠to refresh their ‌devices with AI features.  Subramanya will lead critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models,‍ ML research and will report to software chief Craig Federighi.

title: John Giannandrea to retire from Apple
summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., December 01, 2025--Apple® today announced John Giannandrea, Apple’s senior vice president for Machine Learning and AI Strategy, is stepping down from his position and will serve as an advisor to the company before retiring in the spring of 2026. Apple also announced that renowned AI researcher Amar Subramanya has joined Apple as vice president of AI, reporting to Craig Federighi. Subramanya will be leading critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models, ML research, and AI

raw.headline: John Giannandrea to retire from Apple
raw.summary: CUPERTINO, Calif., December 01, 2025--Apple® today announced John Giannandrea, Apple’s senior vice president for Machine Learning and AI Strategy, is stepping down from his position and will serve as an advisor to the company before retiring in the spring of 2026. Apple also announced that renowned AI researcher Amar Subramanya has joined Apple as vice president of AI, reporting to Craig Federighi. Subramanya will be leading critical areas, including Apple Foundation Models, ML research, and AI

title: Apple set to become the world's top phone maker
summary: Apple (AAPL) is expected to ship more smartphones than Samsung (005930.KS) in 2025, the first time it will have done so in 14 years. That's according to Counterpoint research. The report also said that it sees Apple staying in the top spot of that smartphone market through 2029.  For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

title: EU says Apple Ads and Maps likely qualify as gatekeepers
summary: STORY: The EU Commission said Friday Apple Ads and Apple Maps could likely be deemed “gatekeepers” under the bloc’s digital rules. The tech giant immediately disputed this.So-called gatekeepers have to adhere to a strict set of rules on moderation of content…To allow fair competition and make it easier for consumers to switch between services.The EU’s Digital Markets Act classifies gatekeepers as companies which have over 45 million monthly active users, $79 billion in market capitalization - and which provide a core platform service for business users.The EU Commission said notifications from Apple had shown the platforms met the thresholds set for this designation. The Commission has 45 working days to decide whether to designate Apple as a gatekeeper for any of these services.If designated, Apple will have six months to comply.Apple said in a response on Friday that it had submitted official rebuttals to the pre-designation notification.It said Apple Ads is not a large player in the online advertising services market in the EU, and has minimal share compared to rivals such as Google, Meta, Microsoft, TikTok or X.It also said Maps has very limited usage in the EU compared to other services like Google Maps and Waze.

raw.headline: EU says Apple Ads and Maps likely qualify as gatekeepers
raw.summary: STORY: The EU Commission said Friday Apple Ads and Apple Maps could likely be deemed “gatekeepers” under the bloc’s digital rules. The tech giant immediately disputed this.So-called gatekeepers have to adhere to a strict set of rules on moderation of content…To allow fair competition and make it easier for consumers to switch between services.The EU’s Digital Markets Act classifies gatekeepers as companies which have over 45 million monthly active users, $79 billion in market capitalization - and which provide a core platform service for business users.The EU Commission said notifications from Apple had shown the platforms met the thresholds set for this designation. The Commission has 45 working days to decide whether to designate Apple as a gatekeeper for any of these services.If designated, Apple will have six months to comply.Apple said in a response on Friday that it had submitted official rebuttals to the pre-designation notification.It said Apple Ads is not a large player in the online advertising services market in the EU, and has minimal share compared to rivals such as Google, Meta, Microsoft, TikTok or X.It also said Maps has very limited usage in the EU compared to other services like Google Maps and Waze.
